description.value: For beneficiaries living in long-term care (LTC) facilities, this variable indicates how many days’ supply of the medication was dispensed by the long-term care pharmacy and provides some details about the dispensing event. This variable is only populated when beneficiary lives in an LTC facility (i.e., when the PTNT_RSDNC_CD variable equals 03). Source: https://bluebutton.cms.gov/resources/variables/submsn_clr_cd

display.value: (Unknown value – rarely populated)

definition.value: (Unknown value – rarely populated)

display.value: Therapy change. Physician determined that a change in therapy was required – either the medication was used faster than expected, or a different dosage form is needed.

definition.value: Therapy change. Physician determined that a change in therapy was required – either the medication was used faster than expected, or a different dosage form is needed.

display.value: Emergency supply of non-formulary drugs (or formulary drugs which typically require step therapy or prior authorization). Medication has been determined by the physician to be medically necessary.

definition.value: Emergency supply of non-formulary drugs (or formulary drugs which typically require step therapy or prior authorization). Medication has been determined by the physician to be medically necessary.

display.value: Process compound for approved ingredients

definition.value: Process compound for approved ingredients

display.value: LTC leave of absence – short fill required for take-home use

definition.value: LTC leave of absence – short fill required for take-home use

display.value: LTC emergency box (e box) /automated dispensing machine

definition.value: LTC emergency box (e box) /automated dispensing machine

display.value: LTC emergency supply remainder (remainder of drug from the emergency supply)

definition.value: LTC emergency supply remainder (remainder of drug from the emergency supply)

display.value: LTC patient admit/readmission indicator. This status required new dispensing of medication.

definition.value: LTC patient admit/readmission indicator. This status required new dispensing of medication.

display.value: Split billing. The quantity dispensed is the remainder billed to a subsequent payer after Medicare Part A benefits expired (partial payment under Part A).

definition.value: Split billing. The quantity dispensed is the remainder billed to a subsequent payer after Medicare Part A benefits expired (partial payment under Part A).

display.value: LTC dispensing rule for <=14 day supply is not applicable due to CMS exclusion or the fact that the manufacturer’s packaging does not allow for special dispensing

definition.value: LTC dispensing rule for <=14 day supply is not applicable due to CMS exclusion or the fact that the manufacturer’s packaging does not allow for special dispensing

definition.value: LTC dispensing, 2-day supply

display.value: LTC dispensing, 1-day supply

definition.value: LTC dispensing, 1-day supply

display.value: LTC dispensing, 4-day supply, then 3-day supply

definition.value: LTC dispensing, 4-day supply, then 3-day supply

display.value: LTC dispensing, 2-day supply, then 2-day supply, then 3-day supply

definition.value: LTC dispensing, 2-day supply, then 2-day supply, then 3-day supply

display.value: LTC dispensing, daily during the week then multiple days (3) for weekend

definition.value: LTC dispensing, daily during the week then multiple days (3) for weekend

display.value: LTC dispensing, per shift (multiple medication passes)

definition.value: LTC dispensing, per shift (multiple medication passes)

definition.value: LTC dispensing, per medication pass

definition.value: LTC dispensing, PRN on demand

display.value: LTC dispensing, other <=7 day cycle

definition.value: LTC dispensing, other <=7 day cycle

display.value: LTC dispensing, 14-day supply

definition.value: LTC dispensing, 14-day supply

display.value: LTC dispensing, other 8-14 day dispensing not listed above

definition.value: LTC dispensing, other 8-14 day dispensing not listed above

display.value: LTC dispensing, outside short cycle, determined to be Part D after originally submitted to another payer

definition.value: LTC dispensing, outside short cycle, determined to be Part D after originally submitted to another payer

display.value: The prescriber ID submitted has been validated and is active (rarely populated)

definition.value: The prescriber ID submitted has been validated and is active (rarely populated)

display.value: For the prescriber ID submitted, the associated DEA number has been renewed or the renewal is in progress (rarely populated)

display.value: For the prescriber ID submitted, the associated DEA number is a valid hospital DEA number with suffix (rarely populated)

display.value: Not applicable, beneficiary not in an LTC setting (or in the first two months of 2013, the presumption is there was greater than a 14-day supply)

definition.value: Not applicable, beneficiary not in an LTC setting (or in the first two months of 2013, the presumption is there was greater than a 14-day supply)
